CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper May 22, 1954, pg. 10, reads: "Wins Pittsburghers Scholarship - Attractive Bernice Baines was the happy recipient of the Pittsburghers club scholarship.  Miss Baines graduated from Perry High School and is now a student in Carnegie Institute of Technology, where she is majoring in painting and design. Pictured are, from left to right, Pittsburghers: Aretha Mosley, Mrs. Margarette Burton and Mrs. Ethel Coy.  Miss Baines, seated, is showing them one of her first paintings.  The Pittsburghers thank their friends for support of the Lionel Hampton show at the Vogue Terrace, which benefited the scholarship fund."
TitMainTitle: Aretha Mosley, Margarette Burton, and Ethel Coy gathered around scholarship recipient Bernice Baines holding her painting
